Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2015 05:07AM MarieTherese wrote: thanks for your reply. I am sure I will have many more questions when the report comes back. M
Posts.Title: Area of Distortion and Core needle Biopsy MarieTherese MarieTherese

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2015 07:00PM MarieTherese wrote: I have asked numerous times and have been told that they do not do it like that. I am guessing that my hospital is very conservative and afraid of being sued later so they do not do that kind of testing in a biopsy. I even asked my doctor flat out if anything was being kept from me and was told no. It was even explained that it was illegal to hide or keep any information from me. All of the hormone receptor tests will not be ready until probably the end of September at this point. I meet with the surgeon in the beginning of September. Surgery hopefully the following week and then 5-10 business days after that. It makes me think of that mister Rogers song" let's think of something to do while we are waiting" if you don't know it, look it up on Online. It has become my personal anthem MT
Posts.Title: I am panicking! Changes in diagnosis?? MarieTherese BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2015 01:56PM MarieTherese wrote: Marie -so far I know IDC - small mass 3x3x11 @ 9 o'clock 6 cm from nipple The doctors were very positive and reassuring, but still do not have hormone receptor status. I guess it can only be determined after lumpectomy? I am seeing some comments here and there that mention how much and how often the original diagnosis changed from the start. Just having a moment of panic that maybe I have something far more serious than I thought. Any thoughts on this? MT

Posts.Title: I am panicking! Changes in diagnosis?? MarieTherese BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2015 01:15PM MarieTherese wrote: Thanks windingshores According to some of my lawyer friends who work for hospitals, they often present worse case scenario in order to avoid a lawsuit later. I am sure it depends on the hospital and circumstances, but I am guessing they prefer to err on the side of caution. That , combined with your story, makeme feel a little more hopeful for today! MT
Posts.Title: I am panicking! Changes in diagnosis?? MarieTherese BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2015 06:21PM MarieTherese wrote: I am beginning to think that the biopsies are not as reliable as they could be. My hospital won't even test for hormone receptors until after the lumpectomy. I had this very expensive test that simply confirmed what they already thought and that's it. Tired of waiting! Thanks all- know others are in the same place too. It's so scary MT
Posts.Title: I am panicking! Changes in diagnosis?? MarieTherese BarredOwl

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2015 08:50AM MarieTherese wrote: The docs try to prepare you for the physical part and they do that part (mostly) well. The emotional part for me has been tougher and like any trauma has hit me when I least expect it. ( after good news for example) My family keeps saying, "but you got good news, can't you just enjoy that?" Trying to come to terms with the new normal- Best Marie
